junction module

class junction.Junction(inputInformation)[source]

Bases: object

The class object containing all of the junction information

directions

a dictionary containing all of the direction objects within the junction

Type:

Dictionary

priorityNums

an array containing the priority of each direction [North, East, South, West] in a range 1-4

Type:

Array

isPedestrianCrossing

whether or not this junction has a pedestrain crossing

Type:

Bool

pedCrossPH

the number of pedestrian crossings that occur within an hour

Type:

int

lastCrossingTime

the time that the last pedestrian crossing occured within the junction (during simulation)

Type:

float

trafficSpeed

the speed of the traffic in m/s

Type:

float

pedestrianCrossingTime

the time of a pedestrian crossing in seconds

Type:

float

minimumGreenTime

the minimum amount of time that a green light is on

Type:

float

vehicleLength

the average length of a vehicle in metres

Type:

float

__init__(self, inputInformation)[source]

initialises the Junction object

distributeVehicles(self)[source]

distributes vehicles within each direction to the lanes

calculateDirectionPriority(self)[source]

given the distribution of traffic calculate the priority for each direction

Notes

pedCrossPH, lastCrossingTime and pedestrianCrossingTime are only set if isPedestrianCrossing is equal to True. trafficSpeed, pedestrianCrossingTime, minimumGreenTime and vehicleLength are set using the system.cfg file.

calculateDirectionPriority()[source]

This calculates which directions have the highest VPH and returns a priority ranking based on those VPH

Parameters:

self (Junction) – the junction which contains all of the directions

Returns:

an array storing the priority of the directions in the order [North, East, South, West]

Return type:

array(int)

distributeVehicles()[source]

Distributes the vehicles within each direction of the junction to provide optimal traffic flow

Parameters:

self – the junction that the lanes are in
